mdRecord.dcterms:title: A new and historical map of Albemarle County, Virginia / by Frank A. Massie
Map of Albemarle County, Virginia
Massie map
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Massie, Frank A. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 1 map ; 112 x 103 cm. on sheet 153 x 108 cm.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Map gives centerpoint location: Longitude W. of Washington, 1⁰28'; W. of Greenwich, 78⁰30'. Latitude, 38⁰. [original]
Inset: Junction rail road map of Virginia, also showing relative position of Albemarle Co. in the state. [original]
Includes statistics for Albemarle County and Charlottesville for 1906; population figures for 1900. [original]
Contains geographic and geological features, roads, railroads, telephone lines, post offices, voting places, schools, churches, historic sites, and homes of many county residents. [original]
On some copies, the county border has been outlined in pink. One copy has additional places of interest written in. [original]
Commonly referred to as the Massie map. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Copy 1-3: With border outlined in pink. MYLARED, ROLLED, AND SHELVED IN ELEPHANT FOLIOS RANGE 4. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Copy 4: With additional places of interest written in. [original]

SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Copy 5: With border outlined in pink, mounted on linen. Possibly from the library of Jed Hotchkiss ("Hotchkiss-C?" on Area table card). Folded; shelved in MAP CASES. IN VERY POOR CONDITION: USE ONE OF THE ROLLED COPIES. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Copy 6: Negative photostat, in seventeen sections. Shelved in FLAT MAP BOX [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Copy 7: Blue line print; date of production unknown. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Railroad stations--Virginia--Maps
